contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Japan station |namerom=Hamamatsu |name = 浜松 |image= Hamamatsu Station 2.JPG |imagesize= 300px |caption=Hamamatsu Station south exit in 2012 |pref=Shizuoka |city = Hamamatsu |ward=Naka |address= 6-2 Sunayama-chō |jaloc = 静岡県浜松市中区砂山町6-2 |postal = 430-0926 |open = 1888 |close = |operator = [[JR Central]] |line = [[Tōkaidō Main Line]]<br> [[Tōkaidō Shinkansen]] |stats = 37,250 |statsnote = (FY2006) |bus= t4 }} {{Nihongo|'''Hamamatsu Station'''|浜松駅|Hamamatsu-eki}} is a railway station on the [[Tōkaidō Main Line]] and the [[Tōkaidō Shinkansen]] in [[Hamamatsu, Shizuoka]], Japan, operated by the [[Central Japan Railway Company]] (JR Central). The local [[Enshū Railway Line]] terminus of [[Shin-Hamamatsu Station]] is 3 minutes' walking distance away. ==Lines== Hamamatsu Station is served by the [[Tōkaidō Main Line]] and the high-speed [[Tōkaidō Shinkansen]] from Tokyo. The station is 257.1 rail kilometers from [[Tokyo Station]]. ==Station layout== Hamamatsu Station has two [[island platform]]s serving Tracks 1-4 for the Tōkaidō Shinkansen, which are connected by an [[underpass]] a central concourse. At the same level as the Shinkansen tracks are the two island platforms serving Tracks 5-8 of the Tōkaidō Main Line. The station building has automated [[ticket machine]]s, [[TOICA]] automated [[turnstile]]s and a manned "[[Midori no Madoguchi]]" ticket counter. ===Platforms=== {{ja-rail-linem|span=1|first=2|pfn=1|linename=Home Liner|linecol=orange|dir=for {{ja-stalink|Kakegawa}} and {{ja-stalink|Shizuoka}}}} {{ja-rail-line||pfn=2|linename=Tōkaidō Main Line|linecol=orange|dir= for {{ja-stalink|Toyohashi}} and {{ja-stalink|Nagoya}}}} {{ja-rail-line|pfn=3|nidx=Tōkaidō Main Line|col=orange|dir=for {{ja-stalink|Kakegawa}} and {{ja-stalink|Shizuoka}}}} {{ja-rail-line|pfn=4|nidx=Tōkaidō Main Line|col=orange|dir=for {{ja-stalink|Toyohashi}} and {{ja-stalink|Nagoya}}}} {{ja-rail-line|pfn=5|col=mediumblue|name=Tōkaidō Shinkansen|dir=for {{ja-stalink|Shin-Yokohama}} and {{ja-stalink|Tokyo}}}} {{ja-rail-line|pfn=6|first=3|col=mediumblue|nidx=Tōkaidō Shinkansen|dir=for {{ja-stalink|Nagoya}}, {{ja-stalink|Shin-Osaka}}, and {{ja-stalink|Hakata}}}} == Adjacent stations == {{j-railservice start}} {{j-route|route=Tokaido Shinkansen|col=mediumblue|f=w}} {{j-rserv|previous={{ja-stalink|Shizuoka}}|next={{ja-stalink|Nagoya}}|service=''[[Hikari (train)|Hikari]]''|col=Red}} {{j-rserv|previous={{ja-stalink|Kakegawa}}|next={{ja-stalink|Toyohashi}}|service=''[[Kodama (train)|Kodama]]''|col=Blue}} {{j-rserv|p|service=''[[Nozomi (train)|Nozomi]]''|col=Yellow}} {{j-route|route=Tokaido Main Line|col=orange|f=w}} {{j-rserv|previous={{ja-stalink|Iwata||Shizuoka}}|service=Home Liner|col=red}} {{j-rserv|next={{ja-stalink|Takatsuka}}|service=Special Rapid|col=yellow}} {{j-rserv|next=Takatsuka|service=New Rapid|col=orange}} {{j-rserv|next=Takatsuka|service=Sectional Rapid|col=green}} {{j-rserv|previous={{ja-stalink|Tenryūgawa}}|next=Takatsuka|service=Local|col=gray}} {{s-end}} ==History== {{Unreferenced section|date=January 2013}} Hamamatsu Station was officially opened on September 1, 1888. The station building was rebuilt in 1926, but this burned down during the [[Bombing of Hamamatsu in World War II]]. The station was rebuilt in 1948. On October 1, 1964, the Tōkaidō Shinkansen began operations, serving Hamamatsu. Freight operations were relocated to the Nishi-Hamamatsu Freight Depot to the west in 1971. The station underwent a massive rebuilding program from the late 1970s, with the Tōkaidō Main Line tracks elevated in 1979 to the same level as the Tōkaidō Shinkansen tracks, and the "MayOne" shopping centre/new station building completed in 1981. ==References== *Yoshikawa, Fumio. ''Tokaido-sen 130-nen no ayumi''. Grand-Prix Publishing (2002) ISBN 4-87687-234-1. {{ja icon}} ==External links== {{commons category}} *[http://railway.jr-central.co.jp/station-guide/shinkansen/hamamatsu/index.html　Hamamatsu Station information] (JR Central) {{ja icon}} *[http://www.hi-hice.jp/HICEeng/map.html Hamamatsu Station Area Map] {{Tōkaidō Shinkansen}} {{Tōkaidō Main Line (JR Central)}} {{coord|34|42|13|N|137|44|04|E|display=title|region:JP-22_type:railwaystation_source:dewiki}} [[Category:Railway stations in Shizuoka Prefecture]] [[Category:Transport in Hamamatsu]]
